title: User Guidance for Raman Spectrum Viewer

sections.heading: Getting Started
content: Ensure you have the Raman spectrum data files (in `.txt` format) ready for upload.
Click the *Create spectrum* button to create new spectrum chart. New empty chart will be created.

sections.heading: Visualizing Spectra
content: Select one or more datasets files from your device.
The files should have two columns: X-axis values in the first column and Y-axis values in the second column.
You can upload or create maximum 12 datasets for one spectrum chart.
Once uploaded, the dataset will be displayed automatically as XY-plots.
Each uploaded dataset is displayed as an unique line plot, with colors distinguishing different datasets.
A legend below the graph shows the file names. The legend helps identify each dataset.
Click a legend entry to show or hide the corresponding dataset on chart.

sections.heading: Performing Datasets Operations
content: Each dataset can be modified by performing mathematical operations.
You can add a positive or negative integer to Y-axis values.
You can multiply Y-axis values by positive integer.
You can create new dataset by choosing 2 of already existing datasets and adding or subtracting them.
You can rename or remove dataset in specific dataset settings section.

sections.heading: Adjusting the Graph
content: The X and Y axis ranges automatically adjust to fit the spectrum with the largest range.
Use the legend to remove unnecessary spectra to declutter the plot.
You can change chart type, rename axis or chart title in Spectrum Chart Setting section.

sections.heading: Help and Tips
content: Keep labels short but descriptive to avoid confusion during operations.
Ensure the files have consistent formatting (2 columns separated by spaces, period as decimal separator).
